title: 8/22/2023 - Senate Study Committee on Expanding Georgia's Workforce
summary:

## Overview
This was the third meeting of the Senate Study Committee on Expanding Georgia's Workforce, convened by Lt. Governor Bert Jones. The committee is examining ways to address Georgia's workforce needs and is planning to hold meetings across the state before submitting a final report and recommendations in November.

## Key Actions
None detected.

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
None detected.

## Notable Moments
- The committee chair, Sen. John Albers, welcomed the members and speakers, including representatives from the technical college system, Georgia Chamber of Commerce, Metro Atlanta Chamber, and state senators.
- Lt. Governor's office representative Brad Vaughn provided an overview of the committee's purpose - to find ways to make it easier for Georgians to join the workforce and address the state's growing economic needs.
- The committee plans to hold additional meetings in Commerce, Dalton, and a final session at the state capitol in November.

None detected.

## Adjournment
The session adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for September in Commerce, Georgia.
